title: Matt Godbolt sold me on Rust by showing me C++
summary:
Matt Godbolt sold me on Rust by showing me C++

Matt Godbolt's talk on Correct by Construction: APIs That Are Easy to Use and Hard to Misuse, highlights the problems with C++ and how Rust solves them. The talk covers issues such as floating point conversion, type aliasing, and runtime checks. Rust has the benefit of decades of learning from these issues and has a well-designed language that can protect against mistakes. While memory safety is not the main focus of the talk, it is a key aspect of Rust's design. Overall, the talk provides a good introduction to how Rust can help developers avoid common mistakes and improve the reliability of their code.
